detailsOfAchievement: STEPS AVAHAN PROJECT Implementing roject in 5 sites supported by International HIV/AIDS Alliance, UK. It is an innovative programme to reduce HIV infection amongst Female Sex Workers, and Men Sex with Men and partners, IDUs, People Living with HIV/AIDS (KPs) by developing and enabling environment and providing STI treatment and basic HIV care. Achievements: Clinics were established for treatment of KPs . Provided training for the KPS in correct usage condoms . Advocacy meetings conducted for Stake holders. Exhibition Video shows arranged during festivals to create awareness among general population. Encouraged KPs to form CBOs, 1 MSM CBO, 1 PLWHAS CBO were formed STEPS CLINTON FOUNDATION PEDIATRIC AIDS INITIATIVES Implementing the project in Srikalahasti supported by Vasavya Mahila Mandali lead partner funded by Clinton Foundation USA . Providing services to the HIV positive children STEPS-VMM HCBCS Programme: In Home community based HIV/AIDS care and support programme, providing care, support and treatment to the more number of PLWHAs. Prevention of new infections among high risk population. Supporting income generation activities. Providing nutritional support. Developing linkages with government programmes .Providing educational support and welfare services to the CLHA, CAA .Skill development of the support groups. Psycho social support to the PLHA. Formation and strengthening of Grannies clubs. STEPS-VMM EDC Programme: The HIV affected children were provided educational support in Srikalahasti municipality area. The main supporting activities are paying school fees including examination fees, providing school uniforms, books, stationary and school bags. STEPS URBAN HEALTH CENTRE (STEPS UHC) Running Urban Health Center in the slums of Srikalahasti Municipality covering a population of 20,000. provides 1.Mother and Child Health Services 2.Family Planning Methods and Operations. 3. Awareness on Health related issues.4.Health Education, Awareness Campaigns for Women and Adolescents Conducting Medical Examination for the school children Achievements: Mahila Aarogya sangams and Janani teams were formed and training given to them . Achieved 100% motivation of family planning cases every year. Awareness and motivation created among the SCs,STs community and they are approaching the UHC voluntarily for the family planning operations STEPS UHC is getting A grade every year RCH PROGREMME STEPS implemented the RCH programme in Thottambadu mandal covering a population of 20000 funded by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare Govt of INDIA Achievements: 1. Awareness created among women adolescent girls about RTI STI, HIV/AIDS 2. Institutional deliveries were promoted. 3. High risk cases were identified and achieved 90% referrals to referral hospitals MALARIA ERADICATION PROGRAMME : Conducting free Medical camps in the malaria affected villages and slums and providing clinical services to them. Creating awareness to keep their surroundings clean and hygiene to prevent breeding of mosquitoes which causes Malaria CANCER AWARENESS CAMPS Conducted Cancer awareness camps and detection camps in the villages and LEGAL ASSISTANCE & COUNSELLING CELL FOR WOMEN President of STEPS as a member of Lok Adalat, Srikalahsti in association with Mandal legal literacy authority and local lawyers organized several legal literacy camps in its target villages and as a president of women vigilance cell, solved many problems of women.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Andhra Pradesh State AIDS Control Society APSACS
sourceOfFunds.purpose: STEPS TI program for Key Population in 7 mandals. Organizing clinical services for STI, OI and enhanced the knowledge on STI/HIV/AIDS Improving STI treatment seeking behavior and increasing their access to treatment services. Empowering to follow safe sex behavior, practices preventive interventions Improving the use of condom Developing linkages to access HIV related services, referrals to ICTC, ART and provision of resource directories of available services.

STEPS UHC in Slums of Srikalahasti Municipality provides primary health care, RCH MCH services, Treatment to Diseases, Antenatal and Postnatal care. Health Education and Awareness activities through IEC focusing on Hygiene, Immunization, STI and Family planning. Conducting medical camps for school children.

Incidence of diseases like Filariasis ,Malaria and malnutrition rate are high in slums of Srikalahasti,India. Many people do not have awareness about health and hygiene. People with Malaria, LF suffer from its effects over their entire lifetime. LF develops into chronic conditions, leads to body deformities, causes social stigma and increased medical expenses. STEPS NGO will provide healthcare, health education and awareness to poor slum dwellers. Conducts free health camps

detailsOfAchievement: MISSION STATEMENT Shekinah Foundation has a vision about the persons with disabilities and the poor who are neglected, given unequal treatment and subjected to discrimination in Society. Keeping in view their upliftment and rehabilitation, Shekinah intends to provide them with all the necessary facilities like meaningful education and training so that they can meet the challenges of life. Our mission, therefore is to provide moral and Physical support and encouragement to the disabled who are often seen as a burden on their parents, and are experiencing mental depression and frustration. Shekinah strongly believes that empowerment of persons with disabilities and the poor can be achieved only through education and training with the support of philanthrophic people of the community. The ultimate mission of Shekinah Foundation is to ensure equal opportunities, protection of rights, and creation of a positive environment for the full participation of persons with disabilities in all the areas of social life. Shekinah Foundation, an organization founded and managed by persons with disabilities, has been working for the empowerment of disabled since 1992 in the areas of education, training, rehabilitation, advocacy and awareness generation. The organization and its Founder Mr. Ch. Ishakar, a physically challenged person has achieved the following awards in recognition of best services. 1. National Award by Dr.A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, the then President of India- 2003, 2. State Award-2001-02 by the Govt. of Andhra Pradesh. 3. SEVA BHUSHAN Award has been presented to Mr. Ishakar by ITRRODDD 4. "Best Youth Award" by Nehru Yuva Kendr, Govt. of India-1996

And working on Organic agriculture develoment in two mandals so far trained 1500 farmers. We started information center to help the applicants under Right to Information act,2005 and trained 150 volunterrs to propagate the act at gross root level.we are regularly creating awareness on Environmental issues and providing saplings, material. Apart from these programes we are working on Right based issues, consumer education, Youth welfare, Child welfare and women epowermwnt issues.

detailsOfAchievement: Identified twenty five worthy children to receive aid in the first phase of its operation.These students excelled in studies and passed in their respective grades. The schools also encouraged these students to achieve their best. This was possible once government of India Ministry of Home Affairs granted the first Prior Permission for Solid Rock Childrens Education fund. Students who received aid were given school fee uniform text book note book along with admission fees and registration fee.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Self Help Groups in the area who are willing to undertake their own units for eking their livelihood amidst bad financial conditions, were motivated to learn some skills in Candle Making and Hand Embroidery work. We have undertaken this Training program to them to become skilled and get their work from the market independently and now they are leading happy and peaceful life. We are also providing bank linkage and marketing facilities for

In Kovur and Indukurpet Mandals, we have formed Farmers Clubs with the support of NABARD and with the cooperation of Mandal Agricultural Officers. Model Farmers were gathered for this purpose and conducted Awareness on Dairy Development, Vermi Compost, Need Technology on Agriculture and Exposure Visits.
As Global Warming is very much threatening the world, our society has conducted an Environment

Our society has organized Climate Change Programme in schools and colleges in Kovur Mandal to make them aware of the losses occurring in the surroundings due to global warming. They were advised to plant and grow trees in their vicinity and follow afforestation methods. The society had distributed 160 plants to them with the help of the Forest Department authorities.
With the help of Sri Shirdi Saibaba Trust we have distributed bed sheets to the roadside dwellers to help them to save from cold. About 50 dwellers were benefited through this program.
